thread.title: Girls concoct ridiculous plan to get rid of house rat – and it actually works
thread.title_full: Girls concoct ridiculous plan to get rid of house rat – and it actually works

author: Joshua Barrie
title: Girls concoct ridiculous plan to get rid of house rat – and it actually works
text:
Girls concoct ridiculous plan to get rid of house rat – and it actually works "We were all freaking out..." Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Housemates come up with amazing plan to get rid of rat Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Between 75 and 200 million people died of the plague in the years 1346–1353. The Black Death was a troublesome time. 
The disease is widely believed to have been spread by fleas, which lived on rats. It's one of the reasons people don't care for rats . If you were to find one in your home, you'd probably want to get rid of it. 
Four college roommates found a large rat in their home recently. Jody Mackin and her flatmates Logan, Briana, and Meg were startled to find a pest hiding in their bathroom, and couldn't get pest control out to sort it out. 
So Jody, a senior at Duquesne University in Pittsburgh, and her fellow lasses devised a clever way to remove the rodent. The plan gets underway (Photo: Twitter/@jodeball4REALZ) Read More Unlikely passenger hitches seven-mile ride on back of rubbish truck 
Together, they constructed a rat run of sorts, before coaxing the creature out with a broom handle. A second broom was deployed on the landing, which was used to swiftly encourage the rat down the stairs. It tumbles down, before finally being whacked out of the front door. 
You might be a little concerned for the animal's welfare? Jody pointed out that at least the rat lived, which it wouldn't have done were a trap used. The girls blocked possible escape routes (Photo: Twitter/@jodeball4REALZ) 
“We had a rat last year right around this time and it was huge,” Jody told BuzzFeed . 
“We were all freaking out,” she said. Down the rat tumbles (Photo: Twitter/@jodeball4REALZ) 
Jody tweeted a video of the saga and it's blown up in a big way. She said she's found the hole the rat was using to get in, and plugged it. 
Let's hope she and her friends and rat-free from now on... Bye mate (Photo: Twitter/@jodeball4REALZ)
